abstract: Let $f$ and $g$ be two Hecke-Maass or holomorphic primitive cusp forms for $SL(2,\mathbb{Z})$ and $χ$ be a primitive Dirichlet character of modulus $p$, a prime. A subconvex bound for the central values of the Rankin-Selberg L-functions is $L(s, f \otimes g \otimes χ)$ is give by $$L(\frac{1}{2}, f \otimes g \otimes χ) \ll_{f,g,ε}p^{\frac{22}{23}+ε} ,$$ for any $ε> 0$, where the implied constant depends only on the forms $f,g$ and $ε$.
publication_venue: 18 pages. arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:2111.00696
